column4: probably it's an old driver source, you have anything more recent?
where did you download the source code?
came on cd with device
it's old source code, i see other people mention it on forums.. try using the latest source code..
btw, what's the device id from lspci or lsusb ?
lsusb it's shown
i'm guessing you mean 048d:9135 shows..
it says it's supported but from kernel 3.2 ( http://www.linuxtv.org/wiki/index.php/DVB-T_USB_Devices/Full )
scratch that..
is it supported then?
i dont see the deviceid mentioned on that page, but someone on a forum referred to that post with your device, and tried the latest kernel with it..
try kernel of at least 3.2.xx
umm that might be too advaned for me.
this means you don't use need to use any other source code.. because the usbtv sourcecode should already be with the kernel3.2.xx
it may already be in your repos.. did u try apt-upgrading, or using the latest ubuntu?
easy to change kernal?
kernels dont always replace, apt might add an option to the grub menu..
oh.. so perhaps you may be on kernel3.0xx already..
ok, i will google it and come back if needed.
thanks
you'd need at least 3.2.xx
